text.p: NARODNA OBRODA - French firm Matra Communication will supply the Slovak interior ministry with radio communication equipment. Another French firm, Bull, will provide information technologies for the Economics Ministry, while Eurocopter will start completing its helicopters in Slovakia. All three contracts were signed during Prime Minister Vladimir Meciar's current visit to France.

- The opposition Party of the Democratic Left (SDL) said it would initiate an inspection of the National Property Fund, the state privatisation agency, to audit the fund's liquidity and its control mechanisms.

- A date for a planned visit of Meciar to the Czech Republic and the bilateral talks between Meciar and his Czech counterpart Vaclav Klaus has not been set yet, but both countries continue in negotiations over the visit.
HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - The parliament on Wednesday rejected an amendment to privatisation law, according to which only the government would be entitled to decide on direct privatisation.

SME - President Michal Kovac has asked Meciar to rework his request for the acceptance of Transport Minister Alexander Rezes's resignation. Kovac said the original request, from March 7, was not in accordance with the constitution which is why he could not accept the resignation.
- France supports Slovakia's attempts for integration to the Eurpoean Union and membership in the OECD, French governemnt officials said during Meciar's visit to Paris.
- The government has rejected opposition attempts to oust Culture Minister Ivan Hudec and Interior Minister Gustav Krajci.

PRAVDA - Austrian's Getranke Industrieholding, a daughter company of Vienna's largest brewery Ottakringer, said it had acquired 75 percent of eastern Slovak brewer Saris. Saris's annual production is about 700,000 hectolitres and the brewery has about 17 percent share of the domestic market.
